page.title: 19SWALCLIFFE COMMON
page.content: SWALCLIFFE COMMON IS A PROTECTED AREA OF OUR D-BLOCK, FAMOUS LOCALLY FOR ITS CONTRAST TO ITS INTENSIVELY-FARMED SURROUNDINGS.THE WILDLIFE & PLANT-LIFE OF THE COMMON ARE UNSPOILT AND CHERISHED BY THE LOCALS INHABITANTS. AT ANY TIME OF THE YEAR THE COMMON HOLDS INTEREST FOR THE VISITOR, WHETHER IT BE SEARCHING FOR WILD FLOWERS SUCH AS ORCHIDS, EVIDENCE OF WILD ANIMALS SUCH AS RABBITS, BADGERS AND FOXES OR JUST PEACE AND QUIET. SPECTACULAR PHOTOGRAPHY IS POSSIBLE IN WINTER ESPECIALLY; IN SUMMER THE UNDERGROWTH BECOMES OVERGROWN AND LUSH AND OFTEN DIFFICULT TO WALK THROUGH. THE BIRDS SING LOUDLY AT ALL TIMES OF THE YEAR AND IT IS CERTAINLY A HIGHLIGHT OF OUR D-BLOCK OF STUDY.
